text:
A college principal was shot at by unidentified assailants near Mahuara village here on Saturday. Reacting to this, irate students of the institution clashed with the police, leaving four policemen injured.

Shiv Pratap Misra, principal of Sri Shankar Inter College, Pushpnagar, was on his way to the institution when three bike-borne miscreants fired at him and looted his vehicle near Mahuara village in the Didarganj police station area, Superintendent of Police (City) Vishal Kumar said.

Students indulged in stone-throwing and arson, damaging several police vehicles, he said.

Circle officer Phulpur Satyendra Kumar Singh, police station in-charge of Didarganj, Kumud Shekhar Singh, and two constables were injured in the incident, the SP said.

Personnel from the nearby police stations were rushed to the spot along with the PAC and the situation was brought under control.

A hunt was on to trace three miscreants, Mr. Kumar said. — PTI

title: College principal shot at in Azamgarh
